text_en: No. We did other experiments where we infected with influenza and then vaccinated against a different flu. These unadjuvanted vaccines dont give good primary responses, so this is all ndary. And you can see that whether you have ZBTB32 or not, antibodies stay high.

tweet_text: Why have such a mechanism? In later work, we found that antibodies to persistent infections like CMV keep climbing when there is no ZBTB32. That could potentially overwhelm the system. OK, so 2ndary responses are inherently short-lived, right? https://t.co/cOlxRXfSCd
text_en: Why have such a mechanism? In later work, we found that antibodies to persistent infections like CMV keep climbing when there is no ZBTB32. That could potentially overwhelm the system. OK, so ndary responses are inherently short-lived, right?

tweet_text: When Zbtb32 is gone, antibodies from 2ndary responses persist for longer than they would have otherwise because the plasma cells live for much longer. I interpreted this to mean that there are mechanisms to keep 2ndary responses from going on for too long. https://t.co/CofkrknAPZ https://t.co/DSPT5sgsc9
text_en: When Zbtb32 is gone, antibodies from ndary responses persist for longer than they would have otherwise because the plasma cells live for much longer. I interpreted this to mean that there are mechanisms to keep ndary responses from going on for too long.

tweet_text: The pathways that control how long a plasma cell lives and how long antibodies are made aren't the same in a primary vs. a 2ndary response. 2ndary responses are more complicated b/c there are many flavors of memory B cells that do different things. https://t.co/4oyNqffI4g
text_en: The pathways that control how long a plasma cell lives and how long antibodies are made aren't the same in a primary vs. a ndary response. ndary responses are more complicated b/c there are many flavors of memory B cells that do different things.

tweet_text: Memory B cells don’t produce antibodies unless they see the virus or a booster again. If they do, they can make new plasma cells in a secondary response. https://t.co/YorOWGURPs
text_en: Memory B cells dont produce antibodies unless they see the virus or a booster again. If they do, they can make new plasma cells in a secondary response.

tweet_text: There are some differences between primary responses and secondary responses. In a primary response, naïve B cells become activated and some will become plasma cells. These cells produce a ton of antibodies. Others become memory B cells. https://t.co/AcThGmtS2n
text_en: There are some differences between primary responses and secondary responses. In a primary response, nave B cells become activated and some will become plasma cells. These cells produce a ton of antibodies. Others become memory B cells.
